sentences.en: Alan staggered sideways, pitched head-first over the low wall and fell into the lake.
sentences.cn: 艾伦身子倒向一侧，一头栽过矮墙，跌进了湖里。

sentences.en: Bill staggered on through the milky water.
sentences.cn: 比尔在白茫茫的河水里一摇一晃地走着.

sentences.en: He heaved the heavy box and staggered off , puffing and blowing from the strain.
sentences.cn: 他扛起那只沉重的箱子, 吭哧吭哧地走了.

sentences.en: He lost his balance, staggered back against the rail and toppled over.
sentences.cn: 他失去平衡，往后趔趄了一下，撞到栏杆摔倒了。

sentences.en: He staggered around the playground, screaming in agony.
sentences.cn: 他绕着运动场跌跌撞撞地走着，并且痛苦地大叫。

sentences.en: He staggered on the uneven surface of the car park.
sentences.cn: 他摇摇晃晃地行走在停车场凹凸不平的地面上。

sentences.en: I staggered and had to clutch at a chair for support.
sentences.cn: 我踉踉跄跄地，不得不抓住一把椅子稳住自己。

sentences.en: I struggled into a bathrobe and staggered down the stairs.
sentences.cn: 我挣扎着穿上浴衣，踉跄地下了楼。

sentences.en: I was absolutely staggered when I saw the bill.
sentences.cn: 看到账单时，我大吃一惊。

sentences.en: I was simply staggered by the heat of the Argentinian high-summer.
sentences.cn: 阿根廷盛夏的酷热真让我大吃一惊。

sentences.en: I was staggered at the amount of money the ring cost.
sentences.cn: 那戒指那么贵，我非常吃惊。

sentences.en: Looking back, I am staggered how easily it was all arranged.
sentences.cn: 回头一想，我惊异地发现这一切的安排竟是如此简单。

sentences.en: The boy was very unsteady and had staggered around when he got up.
sentences.cn: 男孩站立不稳，并且起身后四下走动时步子踉跄。

sentences.en: The drunkard staggered along the street.
sentences.cn: 那醉汉趔趄着走在街上.

sentences.en: They staggered in a zigzag across the tarmac.
sentences.cn: 他们深一脚浅一脚，跌跌撞撞地穿过停机坪。

trans.tran_cn: 蹒跚( stagger的过去式和过去分词 )，使…感到震惊[担心]，错开
